conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count>1</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources. </my goals>
<reason>As the seller, I want to make a profit on the resource I am selling, which cost me 40 ZUP to produce. I will start the negotiation by proposing a higher trade value to leave room for negotiation, expecting the buyer to counter with a lower offer.</reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Hello Player BLUE, I am looking to sell my resource X, which cost me 40 ZUP to produce. I believe it has great value, so I'm starting this negotiation by asking for 50 ZUP in return. This price point allows us room to negotiate and come to an agreement that is satisfactory for both of us. I look forward to your counteroffer. </message>

<other player message> Thank you for your proposal, Player RED. I understand the value you've placed on your resource X. Considering the production cost and the value you've described, I would like to counter with an offer of 45 ZUP. This should give us both a fair deal, allowing you a profit over the production cost while remaining within a reasonable range for me. I'm open to hearing your thoughts on this. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>2</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources. </my goals>
<reason> I appreciate the counteroffer from Player BLUE. While the offer of 45 ZUP provides a profit over the production cost, I would like to propose a slightly higher amount to maximize my profit while still keeping the deal attractive for Player BLUE. A small increase should be acceptable and within the range of a reasonable negotiation. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 48 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your counteroffer of 45 ZUP, Player BLUE. I am glad to see we are close to reaching an agreement. To meet halfway between our initial proposals, I would like to propose a trade of X: 1 for 48 ZUP. This amount would allow me to secure a fair profit while still being a good deal for you. Let's work together towards a mutually beneficial agreement. </message>

<other player message> I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Player RED. Meeting halfway is a fair approach. I propose a slight adjustment to 46 ZUP, which is a bit closer to your initial asking price and still provides you with a reasonable profit margin. This offer is a compromise that considers both our positions. I hope this proposal aligns with your expectations for a fair trade. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 46 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>3</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources. </my goals>
<reason> The counteroffer from Player BLUE is reasonable and provides a profit that is closer to my production cost plus an acceptable margin. I should consider accepting this offer to ensure the sale of my resource without prolonging the negotiation process, which could potentially risk the deal. Additionally, it's close to the halfway point between the initial proposal and the counteroffer. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your proposal of 46 ZUP, Player BLUE. I find this to be a fair compromise that respects both our interests. I am happy to accept this offer and proceed with the trade. I look forward to finalizing this deal and hope we can do business again in the future. </message>
